Melee Weapon Proficiency.verbose: When you attack with a strength based weapon, you may add your strength stat to your attack. When you attack with a dexterity based weapon, you may add your dexterity stat to your attack.

Inner Eye.brief: You may make perception checks to detect spiritual energy/magic.
Inner Eye.verbose: You are able to make perception checks to detect spiritual energy and magic.

Escape.brief: Advantage on breaking free of restraints.
Escape.verbose: You have advantage on checks which involve breaking free of restraints.

Listen.brief: You have advantage on perception checks.
Listen.verbose: You have advantage on perception checks. Does not include initiative.

Mantle.verbose: You have advantage on dexterity checks when climbing.

Slowing Blow.brief: Extra damage dice. Spell Power Save. Failure, pushed back 1d4 in initiative.
Slowing Blow.verbose: For one action point, make an attack which deals an additional dice of damage. Force an entity to make a spell power saving throw. On failure, they are pushed back 1d4 turns in initiative.

Make Space.brief: Additional dice of damage. Size based contested STR check. Fail: pushed back 5 feet.
Make Space.verbose: For one action point, make an attack which deals an additional dice of damage. The enemy must make a size based contested strength check against you. On failure, it is pushed back 5 feet.

Dodging Stance.brief: Offhand. Move into a dodging stance. Whenever you are attacked before next turn, contested DEX or half damage.
Dodging Stance.verbose: For 1 Action Point, move into a dodging stance as an Offhand Action. Whenever you are attacked before your next turn, the enemy must roll a contested Dexterity check or miss.

Grappling Dodge.brief: When you dodge a melee attack, you may attempt a contested STR check to grapple.
Grappling Dodge.verbose: When you successfully dodge an enemy melee attack, you may make a contested strength check to attempt to grapple them.

Targeted Attack.brief: Extra damage dice. The enemy must make a size based contested DEX check or knocked prone.
Targeted Attack.verbose: Add an additional damage dice to an attack. Force the attacked entity to make a size based contested Dexterity check or to be knocked prone.

Minor Resting Meditation.brief: Regain 1 additional dice of healing when resting.
Minor Resting Meditation.verbose: Find center by meditating during rests to regain an additional dice of health.

Combo.brief: When you land a crit, make another attack or enter a dodging stance.
Combo.verbose: When you land a critical hit, immediately make an additional attack or enter a dodging stance.

Redirecting Dodge.brief: Redirect any dodged damage to an enemy within range.
Redirecting Dodge.verbose: Redirect any dodged damage to an enemy within range.

Reflexes.brief: Reaction. 1/turn, reduce a projectile's damage by 1d20. If reduced to 0, catch.
Reflexes.verbose: Reaction, attempt to catch a projectile. Roll a d20, and reduce the projectile's damage by that amount. If reduced to zero, you catch the projectile.

Flow with the Battle.brief: Move through spaces occupied by enemies at a 10ft. of movement penalty. Still exposed.
Flow with the Battle.verbose: Move through spaces occupied by enemies at a cost of 10 feet of movement. You still leave yourself exposed as you do this.

Disengage.brief: Avoid provoking exposed attacks. Ends if you make an attack.
Disengage.verbose: Spend an action point to avoid provoking exposed attacks. This effect ends if you make an attack.

Greater Reflexes.brief: Reaction. If you catch an arrow, fire it back at the enemy.
Greater Reflexes.verbose: If you catch a weapon with reflexes, you may immediately make an attack with it.

Consecutive Normal Punches.brief: Make two attacks in an action.
Consecutive Normal Punches.verbose: Make two attacks in an action.

Greater Make Space.brief: Make space now pushes enemies back up to 10 feet.
Greater Make Space.verbose: Make space now pushes enemies back up to 10 feet. You may choose how far to to push them.

Titan-Slayer Punch.brief: Make an attack which ignores armor and deals 1 extra dice of damage to large creatures.
Titan-Slayer Punch.verbose: Make an attack which ignores armor and deals 1 extra dice of damage to creatures of size large or bigger.

Keep Close.brief: When you make space, follow the enemy, stopping anywhere along the way.
Keep Close.verbose: When you make space, you may immediately follow the enemy, stopping anywhere during their movement.

Offhand Attack.brief: You may attack as an offhand.
Offhand Attack.verbose: You may use an offhand action to make an attack.

Greater Resting Meditation.brief: Regain 2 additional dice of healing and 1 extra action point when resting.
Greater Resting Meditation.verbose: Find center by meditating during rests to regain 2 additional dice of health and 1 additional action point.

Chi Block.brief: Make an attack which deals no damage. SP Save. Fail: no abilities or magic next turn.
Chi Block.verbose: Make an attack which deals no damage. The enemy must make a spell power save. On failure, they cannot use abilities or magic on their next turn.

Greater Flow with the Battle.brief: No movement penalty for moving through enemy spaces.
Greater Flow with the Battle.verbose: Passing through enemy spaces no longer results in a movement penalty.

Aerial Acrobatics.brief: If your feet touch something solid, you can spring from it.
Aerial Acrobatics.verbose: You can turn flips and spin in the air. If your feet touch something solid, you can spring from it.

Greater Titan-Slayer Punch.brief: Make an attack which ignores armor and deals 2 extra dice of damage to large creatures.
Greater Titan-Slayer Punch.verbose: Make an attack which ignores armor and deals 2 extra dice of damage to creatures of size large or bigger.

Major Make Space.brief: Make space now pushes enemies back up to 15 feet.
Major Make Space.verbose: Make space now pushes enemies back up to 15 feet. You may choose how far to to push them.

Counterattack Dodge.brief: When you successfully dodge an attack, make a counterattack.
Counterattack Dodge.verbose: When you successfully dodge an attack, you may make a counterattack.

Pressure Points.brief: Make an attack which does no damage. SP save. Fail: prone and paralyzed until next turn.
Pressure Points.verbose: Make an attack which deals no damage. Force an enemy to make a spell power save. On failure, they are knocked prone and considered paralyzed until their next turn.

Major Resting Meditation.brief: Regain 3 additional dice of healing and 2x action points when resting.
Major Resting Meditation.verbose: Find center by meditating during rests to regain 3 additional dice of health and two times the action points.

Greater Combo.brief: When you land a crit, make another attack at no cost or enter a dodging stance.
Greater Combo.verbose: When you land a critical hit, immediately make an additional attack at no cost or enter a dodging stance.

Greater Chi Block.brief: Chi block now lasts until SP save. Enemies repeat save at the end of each of their turns.
Greater Chi Block.verbose: Chi blocking now persists until the enemy makes a Spell Power Save. They may attempt at the end of each of their turns.

Consecutive Serious Punches.brief: Consecutive normal punches no longer has a cost.
Consecutive Serious Punches.verbose: Consecutive normal punches no longer has a cost.

Ultimate Titan-Slayer Punch.brief: Make an attack which ignores armor and deals 3 extra dice of damage to large creatures.
Ultimate Titan-Slayer Punch.verbose: Make an attack which ignores armor and deals 3 extra dice of damage to creatures of size large or bigger.

Slip Away.brief: When you slay an enemy, disengage for free.

Master of Disguise.verbose: You can easily fashion disguises to hide yourself with. Gain advantage when crafting disguises.

Greater Dodge.brief: Whenever targeted. Roll a contested DEX check. Success: attack misses.
Greater Dodge.verbose: Every time you are the target of a targeted attack, the enemy must succeed a contested Dexterity check or miss.

Ride the Blindspot.brief: If a flanked enemy turns to attack you, pivot to stay behind it.

Offhand Attack.verbose: You may use an offhand action to make an attack.

Break Away.verbose: If you begin a turn flanking an enemy, you may break from them without provoking exposed attacks.

Sticky Fingers.brief: Add 1d4 to checks made to steal something.
Sticky Fingers.verbose: Add 1d4 to any check made to steal something.

Party Save.brief: Add 1d10 to all allies' stealth check.

Spell of True Sight.brief: Offhand. See invisible things and have darkvision for 1 hour.

Bard.description: Showmen by nature, Bards are known for their skills at performing and distracting others from the sorrows of life. Bards are usually at least a little bit gaudy and outgoing. Cleric.description: After pledging their allegiance to their deity, Clerics have made it their duty to follow their will. Clerics are weak, and do not fight with physical weapons. However, they are powerful spellcasters who are adept at healing, and who can make a huge difference in combat. Marriage.brief: You may marry to individual. They may swap initiative and have advantage in all things when the other is on death's door.
Marriage.verbose: You may bond two individuals together in marriage. When fighting together, they are able to swap turns in initiative order and gain advantage on all checks when the other is critically injured.

Atonement.brief: You may grant forgiveness to an individual in the name of your god.
Atonement.verbose: An individual can come to you to ask for atonement for evil they have done. After listening, you may give the entity a penance of your choice. Upon completion, they are restored to purity.

Funeral.brief: You may perform a funeral which delivers a soul safely to the other side. The body cannot be resurrected by an evildoer.
Funeral.verbose: Upon an individual’s death, you can perform a funeral for them. Any entity that recieved a proper funeral cannot be resurrected by an evil entity.

Birthing.brief: You have advantage when performing births, and may bless babies in the name of your diety until they are of age.
Birthing.verbose: If you are present for an individual's birth, you gain advantage during delivery. A baby blessed by you is protected by your diety until they are ten years of age.

Conversion.brief: You are able to convert individual's to your god.
Conversion.verbose: If an individual wishes to convert to follow your diety, you are able to perform the proper rites

Guidance.brief: Add a major dice to an ally's check or attack.
Guidance.verbose: Spend 1 action point to add a major dice to an ally's check or attack.

God of Undeath.brief: You have access to the macabre manual.
God of Undeath.verbose: You have access to the macabre manual.

The Book of Healing.brief: You have access to the Book of Healing.
The Book of Healing.verbose: You are able to learn spells from the Book of Healing.

Purge Decay.brief: Add an additional dice of damage when fighting the undead/demons.
Purge Decay.verbose: Add an additional dice of damage when fighting demons or the undead.

Defiled Healing.brief: Any of your healing spells may instead be used to deal damage.
Defiled Healing.verbose: Any of your healing spells may instead be used to deal damage.

Holy Orders.brief: Mark an enemy. Hurting it heals a minor dice. Killing restores the max roll.
Holy Orders.verbose: Mark an enemy as an offhand action. Damage done to that enemy heals your allies for a minor dice. Slaying the entity restores the max possible roll.

Greater Waste Not.brief: You may instantly resurrect any enemy you kill as a Zombie.
Greater Waste Not.verbose: You may instantly resurrect any enemy you kill as a Zombie.

Tier Four Spells.verbose: You are a master of your spellcraft. You can now learn tier four spells from any of your spellbooks.

Sustained Healing.brief: Have a healing spell heal half as much on the following turn.
Sustained Healing.verbose: Add 1 to the cost of any healing spell to have it heal half as much on the following turn.

Major Offhand Spell.brief: You may cast a tier 2 spell as an offhand.
Major Offhand Spell.verbose: You may cast a tier two spell as an offhand action.

Greater True Heal.brief: Re-roll any ones or twos rolled while healing.
Greater True Heal.verbose: Re-roll any ones or twos rolled while healing.

Untethered.brief: You no longer require food or sleep. You are aware of pain, but it does not bother you.
Untethered.verbose: You no longer require food or sleep. You are aware of pain, but it does not bother you.

Feed on the Dying.brief: You regain a major dice of health whenever an entity dies near you.
Feed on the Dying.verbose: Regain a major dice of health whenever an entity dies near you.

Tier Five Spells.verbose: You have achieved the highest form of magic, and are a mage to be reckoned with. You can now learn tier five spells from any of your spellbooks.

Major Waste Not.brief: You may instantly resurrect any enemy you kill as a Ghoul.
Major Waste Not.verbose: You may instantly resurrect any enemy you kill as a Ghoul.

Tier One Spells.verbose: Your powers are growing. You may now learn tier one spells from any of your spellbooks.

Lifeline.brief: When an ally within 30ft. falls to 0 health, instead keep them at 1.
Lifeline.verbose: When an ally within 30ft. of you drops to 0 health, call upon your deity to instead keep them at 1.

Resistant to Decay.brief: You take half damage from necrotic attacks.
Resistant to Decay.verbose: You take half damage from necrotic attacks.

Shield of Light.brief: Stop an enemy attack from harming you.
Shield of Light.verbose: Block an incoming attack from harming you as a reaction.

Tier Two Spells.verbose: You have graduated from novice to proficient! You may now learn tier two spells from any of your spellbooks.

Pledge.brief: You are able to bind a willing servant of your diety to you.
Pledge.verbose: On your journey, an individual may pledge themselves to protect and serve you. They must have already been converted to your deity. If they so choose, you must both go to a temple of your deity, or, that being unavailable, craft one. To craft a temple, you must bless it with ash created from a holy flame and with holy water. The one who is swearing allegiance must pledge to be always at your side, put you above themself, and share of everything they have with you. You must pledge to uphold their dignity, and to ever be their ally. You then each must make a small incision on your hand and mingle your blood. From that point on, you may speak with eachother telepathecially, always have a vague idea of where the other is, and may split evenly the effects of any potion or food. If either of you move more than one mile apart, you both want desperately to be reunited. If either of you choose to end this bond, you both must recieve a permanent penalty of -1 vitality. If this decreases vitality to zero, instead take a permanent decrease of 10 health.

Minor Waste Not.brief: You may instantly resurrect any enemy you kill as a skeleton.
Minor Waste Not.verbose: You may instantly resurrect any enemy you kill as a skeleton.

True Heal.brief: Re-roll any ones rolled while healing.
True Heal.verbose: Re-roll any ones rolled while healing.

Offhand Attack.brief: You may attack as an offhand.
Offhand Attack.verbose: You may use an offhand action to make an attack.

Offhand Spell.brief: You may cast a tier 0 and 1 spells as an offhand action.
Offhand Spell.verbose: You may cast a tier zero and one spells as an offhand action.

Tier Three Spells.verbose: Magical energy flows through you. You may now learn tier three spells from any of your spellbooks.

Magically Sustained Body.brief: Your body passively feeds on the life around it, you now require 1/10th the food, and only 2 hours of sleep.
Magically Sustained Body.verbose: Your body passively feeds on the life around it, you now require 1/10th the food, and only 2 hours of sleep.

Greater Purge Decay.brief: Demons and undead have disadvantage vs saves against your spells.
Greater Purge Decay.verbose: Demons and undead have disadvantage vs saves against your spells.

Cleric of Undeath.standings: Clerics are friends to all those who fight for good, and get along especially well with Holy Knights, Paladins, and members of their church.

Spell Choice.verbose: At the start of your journey, you know 2 extra tier zero spells.

Elementalist Druid.description: Gaurdians of nature, most druids prefer to live in tribes in the forests, mountains, prairie, tundra, or desert. Druid's command powerful nature based magic, which they use to smite those who threaten them, their friends, or their home. Druids utilize intelligence based action points to cast spells, and are a good match for players interested in playing a mage. As you build your druid, consider where they came from. Why are they so attached to nature? How does their attachment to the natural world change how they think? How do they react to large towns and cities? What do they wear, and how do they speak? How do they feel about other types of magic? Why are they on their adventure? How do they feel about eating meat? What are their values? What do they think the place of people is in the world? How will being a druid change the way you interact with your party?

Learning Spells.brief: You can learn new spells from spellbooks or when you level up.
Learning Spells.verbose: New spells or techniques are obtained by leveling up or by finding spellbooks or scrolls in the world. A spellbook may contain a specific spell, or a maximum spell tier. Spellbooks with a maximum spell tier contain one spell of your choice from the spellbooks that you can learn from with a tier up to the spellbook's maximum spell tier.

Learn Spells.brief: Each time you level up, learn one new spell of each spell tier you have access to.
Learn Spells.verbose: Each time you level up, learn one new spell of each spell tier that you have access to. Spells must be learned from one of your spellbooks.

Melee Weapon Proficiency.brief: You are able to use hand to hand weapons without disadvantage.
Melee Weapon Proficiency.verbose: When you attack with a strength based weapon, you may add your strength stat to your attack. When you attack with a dexterity based weapon, you may add your dexterity stat to your attack.

Tier Zero Spells.verbose: You have achieved a basic knowledge of the arcane, and may now learn tier zero spells from any of your spellbooks.

The Druid's Field Guide.brief: You have access to the Druid's Field Guide.
The Druid's Field Guide.verbose: You can learn spells from the Druid's Field Guide.

Chosen Element.brief: Choose an element from Fire, Water, Earth, Air to be proficient in.
Chosen Element.verbose: Choose a starting element from the following list: Fire, Water, Earth, Air. You are a natural at manipulating and utilizing elemental magic of that type.

Empowered Elements.brief: Enemies make disadvantaged spell power saves against your chosen element attacks.
Empowered Elements.verbose: Enemies must make spell power saves against attacks that you make with one of your chosen elements at disadvantage.

Elemental Adept.brief: Spells which use one of your chosen elements cost you 1 fewer action points
Elemental Adept.verbose: Spells which have a type corresponding with one of your chosen elements cost you one fewer action points.

Elemental Strike.brief: Free Action. Convert your damage to a different type for 1 turn.
Elemental Strike.verbose: Convert your melee damage to a different type as a free action.

Tier One Spells.verbose: Your powers are growing. You may now learn tier one spells from any of your spellbooks.

Second Element.brief: Choose a second element from Fire, Water, Earth, Air to be adept in.
Second Element.verbose: Choose a second element from Fire, Water, Earth, and Air to be adept in.

Elemental Resistance.brief: You are resistant to damage from your chosen elements.
Elemental Resistance.verbose: You are resistant to damage from any of your chosen elements.

Tier Two Spells.verbose: You have graduated from novice to proficient! You may now learn tier two spells from any of your spellbooks.

Third Element.brief: Choose a third element from Fire, Water, Earth, Air to be adept in.
Third Element.verbose: Choose a third element from Fire, Water, Earth, and Air to be adept in.

Offhand Spell.brief: You may cast a tier 0 and 1 spells as an offhand action.
Offhand Spell.verbose: You may cast a tier zero and one spells as an offhand action.

Greater Empowered Elements.brief: Your elemental damage ignores enemy resistance.
Greater Empowered Elements.verbose: Your elemental damage ignores enemy resistances.

Tier Three Spells.verbose: Magical energy flows through you. You may now learn tier three spells from any of your spellbooks.

Final Element.brief: Choose a forth element from Fire, Water, Earth, Air to be adept in.
Final Element.verbose: Choose a forth element from Fire, Water, Earth, and Air to be adept in.

Elemental Ascension.brief: Lasts 3 turns/15 mins. Gain 5 action points, which may go past your max. When you leave the ascended state, you are exhausted and immediately take 2x your level in damage. If you are killed in the ascended state, you cannot be resurrected.
Elemental Ascension.verbose: The power of the four elements infuses and empowers you. When you enter the ascended state, immediately gain 5 action points, which may go past your maximum. The ascended state lasts for 3 turns or fifteen minutes. When you fall out of the ascended state, you are fatigued, immediately take twice your level in damage, and have disadvantage in all things until you are able to sleep. If you are killed in the ascended state, you cannot be resurrected.

Tier Four Spells.verbose: You are a master of your spellcraft. You can now learn tier four spells from any of your spellbooks.

Pure Elemental Attack.brief: While Ascended, deal an additional dice of damage on all elemental attacks
Pure Elemental Attack.verbose: Your elemental power becomes so fierce in the Ascended State that it deals an additional dice of damage.

Major Offhand Spell.brief: You may cast a tier 2 spell as an offhand.
Major Offhand Spell.verbose: You may cast a tier two spell as an offhand action.

Ascended Flight.brief: You may fly at twice your normal speed while in the ascended state.
Ascended Flight.verbose: When in the ascended state, utilize the power of air to propel yourself through the skies in unaided flight at twice your normal speed.

True Ascension.brief: Ascended: No use limit, adv on PER/INF. When ended, D10 INF save. Fail: fatigued.
True Ascension.verbose: Ascension no longer has a time limit. While ascended, you make all perception checks and spell power saves with advantage. You may enter and leave the ascended state as often as you want, but only gain the additional spell points once per long rest. When you leave the ascended state, make an inner fire saving throw. If it is less than 10, you are fatigued.

Elemental Aura.brief: While Ascended, cast a 30ft. radius aura of elemental energy. 1 major dice of elemental damage to all enemies within.
Elemental Aura.verbose: While in the Ascended State, cast a 30 foot radius of elemental energy. All enemies within the aura take 1 greater dice of damage of an element of your choice.

Tier Five Spells.verbose: You have achieved the highest form of magic, and are a mage to be reckoned with. You can now learn tier five spells from any of your spellbooks.

Stay on Your Feet.brief: If your health hits 0, make a D10 INF save. On success, drop to 1 hp instead.
Stay on Your Feet.verbose: If you fall to zero health, make a D10 inner fire saving throw. If you succeed, drop to 1 health instead.

Ascended Action.brief: When ascended, take an action and movement when it is not your turn. Once per turn.
Ascended Action.verbose: Once per turn while ascended, you may take an extra action and movement when it is not your turn.

Spell Choice.verbose: At the start of your journey, you know 2 extra tier zero spells.

Necromancer.description: Death is not my enemy, nor is it my ally, it is my servant. So say Necromancers, mages who study the intricacies of death, and what follows after. Often fuled by macabre fasination or a god complex, Necromancy is deeply feared and considered taboo by almost everyone. Clerics and Paladins, in particular, may despise or hunt necromacers. At the beginning of their journey, necromancers may choose to be vegan, promising only to eat the souls of evil individuals. As you create your necromancer, consider their values. How did they end up studying such horrible magics? Was it out of necessity? Curiosity? What are they hoping to accomplish? How do they rationalize what they do? Do they have any ticks or quirks? How will being a necromancer affect how you interact with your party?

Learning Spells.brief: You can learn new spells from spellbooks or when you level up.
Learning Spells.verbose: New spells or techniques are obtained by leveling up or by finding spellbooks or scrolls in the world. A spellbook may contain a specific spell, or a maximum spell tier. Spellbooks with a maximum spell tier contain one spell of your choice from the spellbooks that you can learn from with a tier up to the spellbook's maximum spell tier.

Soul Harvest.brief: You can harvest 1 soul from a sentient entity that has died within 24 hours.
Soul Harvest.verbose: You may harvest 1 soul from a sentient entity that has died within twenty four hours.

Soul Based Magic.brief: To fuel your magic you use souls which are stored in your soul jar. When they are used, souls escape to the hereafter.
Soul Based Magic.verbose: To fuel your magic, you use the concentrated essence of life, which you are able to harvest from the dead. These "souls" are stored in your soul jar until they are expended on a spell or by an ability. At that time, they escape to the hereafter.

Learn Spells.brief: Each time you level up, learn one new spell of each spell tier you have access to.
Learn Spells.verbose: Each time you level up, learn one new spell of each spell tier that you have access to. Spells must be learned from one of your spellbooks.

Tier Zero Spells.verbose: You have achieved a basic knowledge of the arcane, and may now learn tier zero spells from any of your spellbooks.

Soul Detection.brief: You are able to detect life and fresh corpses at a range of 30ft.
Soul Detection.verbose: You are able to detect life and freshly dead corpses at a range of 30 feet.

Mortal Coil.brief: 1/week, consume a soul to avoid rotting.
Mortal Coil.verbose: Once every week, you must consume a soul. If you do not, your body begins to rot away, causing fear and horror in those who see you.

Vegan.brief: If you haven't harvested a soul in 1 month, ADV on soul jar restocks.
Vegan.verbose: You may refuse to harvest and consume souls. If you have not harvested a soul within 1 month, roll all soul jar restocks with advantage.

Minor Undead Minions.brief: You may control up to 1 undead thralls at a time.
Minor Undead Minions.verbose: Using the untapped power of sentient souls, you are able to resurrect up to 1 undead thrall at a time.

Resurrect Skeleton.brief: Spend 1 soul to raise a skeleton from the corpse of a fallen entity. See the Book of Known Beasts for Stats.
Resurrect Skeleton.verbose: Spend 1 soul to raise a skeletal minion from a fallen entity. See the book of known beasts for details.

The Macabre Manual.brief: You have access to the Macabre Manual.
The Macabre Manual.verbose: You are able to learn spells from the Macabre Manual.

Soul Jar.brief: You have a soul jar which produces 1d6 souls at midnight (max 2). Your soul jar can hold a number of souls equal to your action points.
Soul Jar.verbose: You have a soul jar, which produces 1d6 souls each day at midnight, the jar can produce 2 souls at maximum. Your soul jar is capable of holding a number of souls equal to your action points.

Infusion of Life.brief: Eat a soul. +1 to stat or d10 heal. If 4/day eaten, Mortal Coil 1/day 3 days.
Infusion of Life.verbose: You can consume a soul to increase a stat by 1 or to give yourself a temporary increase of 1d10 health. If you consume more than 3 in a day, decrease the time limit on Mortal Coil to once per day for three days.

Resurrect Zombie.brief: Spend 2 souls to raise a zombie from the corpse of a fallen entity. See the Book of Known Beasts for Stats.
Resurrect Zombie.verbose: Spend 2 souls to raise a zombie minion from a fallen entity. See the book of known beasts for details.

Dark Blade.brief: Spend 1 soul to add a dice of shadow damage to your weapon.
Dark Blade.verbose: Spend a soul to add an additional dice of shadow damage to your weapon.

Tier One Spells.verbose: Your powers are growing. You may now learn tier one spells from any of your spellbooks.

Greater Undead Minions.brief: You may control up to 2 undead thralls at a time.
Greater Undead Minions.verbose: Using the untapped power of sentient souls, you are able to resurrect up to 2 undead thralls at a time.

Fear the Light.brief: You are considered undead, and take extra damage from holy weapons.
Fear the Light.verbose: You are considered undead, and therefore take extra damage from holy weapons.

Darkvision.brief: You can see in perfect dark.
Darkvision.verbose: You can see even in perfect darkness.

Larger Soul Jar.brief: Your soul jar can produce at maximum 1 more soul per day.
Larger Soul Jar.verbose: Your soul jar can produce at maximum 1 more soul per day.

Eyes of the Others.brief: You may see through the eyes of your minions. You cannot command them in this way.
Eyes of the Others.verbose: You are able to see through the eyes of your minions, though you may not command them in this way.

Tier Two Spells.verbose: You have graduated from novice to proficient! You may now learn tier two spells from any of your spellbooks.

Major Undead Minions.brief: You may control up to 5 undead thralls at a time.
Major Undead Minions.verbose: Using the untapped power of sentient souls, you are able to resurrect up to 5 undead thralls at a time.

Larger Soul Jar.brief: Your soul jar can produce at maximum 1 more soul per day.
Larger Soul Jar.verbose: Your soul jar can produce at maximum 1 more soul per day.

Resurrect Ghoul.brief: Spend 3 souls to raise a ghoul from the corpse of a fallen entity. See the Book of Known Beasts for Stats.
Resurrect Ghoul.verbose: Spend 3 souls to raise a ghoul from a fallen entity. See the book of known beasts for details.

Offhand Attack.brief: You may attack as an offhand.
Offhand Attack.verbose: You may use an offhand action to make an attack.

Offhand Spell.brief: You may cast a tier 0 and 1 spells as an offhand action.
Offhand Spell.verbose: You may cast a tier zero and one spells as an offhand action.

Tier Three Spells.verbose: Magical energy flows through you. You may now learn tier three spells from any of your spellbooks.

Reap.brief: When you harvest a soul, roll 1d20. If 15 or above, harvest 2. If you are vegan, restore 2 souls on rest.
Reap.verbose: When you harvest a soul, roll a d20. If you roll 15 or above, harvest 2. If you are currently a vegan, begin to restore 2 souls during any rest.

Larger Soul Jar.brief: Your soul jar can produce at maximum 1 more soul per day.
Larger Soul Jar.verbose: Your soul jar can produce at maximum 1 more soul per day.

Legendary Undead Minions.brief: You may control up to 100 undead thralls at a time.
Legendary Undead Minions.verbose: Using the untapped power of sentient souls, you are able to resurrect up to 100 undead thralls at a time.

Phylactery.brief: Bind soul to phylactery. If body dies, possess thrall or resurrect tomorrow.
Phylactery.verbose: You may remove your soul and put it in a box. If the box is destroyed, you are destroyed with it. If your body dies and you have a thrall, your consciousness may be transferred to the thrall. If you have no thralls remaining, your body is regenerated at your phylactery after one day.

Tier Four Spells.verbose: You are a master of your spellcraft. You can now learn tier four spells from any of your spellbooks.

Resurrect Death Knight.brief: Spend 4 souls to raise a death knight from the corpse of a fallen entity. See the Book of Known Beasts for Stats.
Resurrect Death Knight.verbose: Spend 4 souls to resurrect a Death Knight to aid you. See the book of known beasts for details.

Major Offhand Spell.brief: You may cast a tier 2 spell as an offhand.
Major Offhand Spell.verbose: You may cast a tier two spell as an offhand action.

Larger Soul Jar.brief: Your soul jar can produce at maximum 1 more soul per day.
Larger Soul Jar.verbose: Your soul jar can produce at maximum 1 more soul per day.

Freed from this Mortal Coil.verbose: You may bond your consciousness to one of your minions, taking full control of them. If the minion is destroyed, your soul returns to your primary body, another thrall, or to your phylactery.

Tier Five Spells.verbose: You have achieved the highest form of magic, and are a mage to be reckoned with. You can now learn tier five spells from any of your spellbooks.

Resurrect Abomination.brief: Spend 5 souls to raise an abomination from the corpses of 5 fallen entities. See the Book of Known Beasts for Stats.
Resurrect Abomination.verbose: Spend 5 souls to knit together a monstrous abomination to fight for you. Requires 5 corpses. See the book of known beasts for details.

Army of the Damned.brief: Resurrect every entity within 100 feet as a zombie for 5 souls.
Army of the Damned.verbose: As an action, resurrect every entity within 100 feet as a zombie at the cost of 5 souls.

Necromancer.standings: Necromancers are feared by most, and are actively hunted by Clerics and followers of the light.

Spell Choice.verbose: At the start of your journey, you know 2 extra tier zero spells.

Sorcerer.description: Sorcerer's draw their magic not from cryptic tomes nor nuanced understanding, but rather through raw force of personality. To perform magic, a sorcerer wrestles with a spirit, natural or otherwise, and convinces them to do their bidding. To this end, Sorcerers do not use action points to cast spells, but rather must pass a charisma check to perform magic. As you create your sorcerer, consider how they learned magic. Who did they learn it from? How did they first wrestle a spirit to aid them? When they cast a spell, do they always use the same spirit, or different spirits? Is the spirit natural, or the soul of someone who is gone? How will being a sorcerer change the way that you interact with the world and your party?

Learning Spells.brief: You can learn new spells from spellbooks or when you level up.
Learning Spells.verbose: New spells or techniques are obtained by leveling up or by finding spellbooks or scrolls in the world. A spellbook may contain a specific spell, or a maximum spell tier. Spellbooks with a maximum spell tier contain one spell of your choice from the spellbooks that you can learn from with a tier up to the spellbook's maximum spell tier.

Charisma Based Spellcaster.brief: To cast spells, make a CHA check and beat the spell's difficulty.
Charisma Based Spellcaster.verbose: To succeed at casting spells, you must convince your familiar to perform it for you. To do this, roll a d20 and add your charisma. The result must beat the difficulty of the spell.

Learn Spells.brief: Each time you level up, learn one new spell of each spell tier you have access to.
Learn Spells.verbose: Each time you level up, learn one new spell of each spell tier that you have access to. Spells must be learned from one of your spellbooks.

Tier Zero Spells.verbose: You have achieved a basic knowledge of the arcane, and may now learn tier zero spells from any of your spellbooks.

Influence.brief: You can use action points to add +3 to a CHA role.
Influence.verbose: You may use action points to increase any charisma roll by 3.

Summon Minor Familiar.brief: Summon an ethereal beast of level 0 (light) or lower from the book of known beasts.
Summon Minor Familiar.verbose: Summon an ethereal beast of level 0 (light) or lower from the book of known beasts.

Novice Spellbook.brief: You have access to the Novice spellbook.
Novice Spellbook.verbose: You are able to learn spells from the Novice Spellbook.

The Sorcerer's Scrolls.brief: You have access to the Sorcerer's Scrolls
The Sorcerer's Scrolls.verbose: You are able to learn spells from the Sorcerer's Scrolls.

Empower Spell Modification.brief: Increase spell difficulty by 4 to add a dice. Stackable.
Empower Spell Modification.verbose: Increase the difficulty of a spell by 4 to add an additional dice. Stackable.

Tier One Spells.verbose: Your powers are growing. You may now learn tier one spells from any of your spellbooks.

Through My Familiar's Eyes.brief: View the world through your familiar's eyes or ears. Increase cost by 1 for both.
Through My Familiar's Eyes.verbose: View the world through your familiar's eyes or ears. Increase cost by 1 for both.

Spell Volume Modification.brief: Increase spell difficulty by 2, increase or decrease it's audible volume.
Spell Volume Modification.verbose: Increase the difficulty of a spell by 2 to change it's audible volume.

Spell Element Modification.brief: Increase spell difficulty by 3 to change damage type.
Spell Element Modification.verbose: Increase the difficulty of a spell by 3 to change its damage type.

Tier Two Spells.verbose: You have graduated from novice to proficient! You may now learn tier two spells from any of your spellbooks.

Summon Greater Familiar.brief: Summon an ethereal beast of level 3 (heavy) or lower from the book of known beasts.
Summon Greater Familiar.verbose: Summon an ethereal beast of level 3 (heavy) or lower from the book of known beasts.

Offhand Modification.brief: Increase a spell's difficulty by its tier to cast it as an offhand action.
Offhand Modification.verbose: Increase the difficulty of a spell by its tier to cast it as an offhand action.

Fuse into Familiar.brief: Offhand. Touch your familiar to fuse. Lasts 10 minutes.
Fuse into Familiar.verbose: Touch your familiar to fuse with it. Lasts for up to 10 minutes, before you reappear where your familiar stands.

Spell Area Modification.brief: Increase spell difficulty by 3, 2x or 1/2 its AOE.
Spell Area Modification.verbose: Increase the difficulty of a spell by 3 to double or half its area of effect.

Offhand Attack.brief: You may attack as an offhand.
Offhand Attack.verbose: You may use an offhand action to make an attack.

Tier Three Spells.verbose: Magical energy flows through you. You may now learn tier three spells from any of your spellbooks.

Summon Major Familiar.brief: Summon an ethereal beast of level 5 (heavy) or lower from the book of known beasts.
Summon Major Familiar.verbose: Summon an ethereal beast of level 5 (heavy) or lower from the book of known beasts.

Prepare Spell.brief: At the start of the day, choose a spell to have 3 less difficulty.
Prepare Spell.verbose: At the start of each day, choose a spell to have 3 less difficulty.

Blink to Familiar.brief: Offhand. Instantly teleport to your familiar.
Blink to Familiar.verbose: As an offhand action, instantly teleport to your familiar.

Tier Four Spells.verbose: You are a master of your spellcraft. You can now learn tier four spells from any of your spellbooks.

Spirits Within.brief: Wrestle spirit. 1/turn D10 INF save or 2d6 dmg. 1, escapes. ADV CHA, +1 STR DEX PER INF.
Spirits Within.verbose: Wrestle with a spirit, forcing it to fill you with its strength. Every turn that you are imbued with a spirit, make a D10 inner fire saving throw. If you fail, take 2d6 psychic damage. If you critically fail, the spirit escapes you. While you are imbued with a spirit, you have advantage on all charisma checks and may add +1 to strength, dexterity, perception, and inner fire.

Greater Fuse into Familiar.brief: There is no longer a time limit for how long you can fuse with your familiar.
Greater Fuse into Familiar.verbose: There is no longer a time limit for how long you can fuse with your familiar.

Major Offhand Spell.brief: You may cast a tier 2 spell as an offhand.
Major Offhand Spell.verbose: You may cast a tier two spell as an offhand action.

Summon Legendary Familiar.brief: Summon an ethereal beast of level 10 (heavy) or lower from the book of known beasts.
Summon Legendary Familiar.verbose: Summon an ethereal beast of level 10 (heavy) or lower from the book of known beasts.

Tier Five Spells.verbose: You have achieved the highest form of magic, and are a mage to be reckoned with. You can now learn tier five spells from any of your spellbooks.

Enforce Will Modification.brief: Increase spell difficulty by 3 to force an enemy to make related saves at disadvantage.
Enforce Will Modification.verbose: Increase the difficulty of a spell by 3 to force an enemy to make any related saves with disadvantage.

Tie Off Modification.brief: Increase concentration spell difficulty by 4 to leave it in place for 20 minutes.
Tie Off Modification.verbose: Increase the difficulty of a concentration spell by 4 to tie it off, leaving it in place for 20 minutes.

Light and Shadow.brief: While you possess a spirit, add 1 extra dark/light dmg dice to attacks, gain darkvision, adv on INF saves.
Light and Shadow.verbose: While you possess a spirit, add an extra dice of dark or light damage to any attack that you make. Further, gain the darkvision ability, and advantage on any inner fire saving throws, including the one used to keep control of the spirit.

Historian.brief: You have advantage on history or geography checks.
Historian.verbose: You have a deep knowledge of the land in which your adventure takes place. You gave advantage on any history or geography checks.

Wizard.description: Often eccentric, wizards are known to be wayfarers and meddlers. Most keep to themselves, approaching others only to entwine them in schemes only they know about. Wizards arrive precisely when they mean to. To use magic, Wizards use action points to cast spells. Wizards gain access to new spell tiers before any other class. As you create your wizard, consider what their past is. How old are they? What kind of family did they come from? How long have they been a wizard? Are they mysterious? Are they competent? How do they interact with others? Who taught them magic? How will being a wizard affect how you interact with your other party members?

Spell Choice.verbose: At the start of your journey, you know 2 extra tier zero spells.

Learn Spells.brief: Each time you level up, learn one new spell of each spell tier you have access to.
Learn Spells.verbose: Each time you level up, learn one new spell of each spell tier that you have access to. Spells must be learned from one of your spellbooks.

Tier Zero Spells.verbose: You have achieved a basic knowledge of the arcane, and may now learn tier zero spells from any of your spellbooks.

Learning Spells.brief: You can learn new spells from spellbooks or when you level up.
Learning Spells.verbose: New spells or techniques are obtained by leveling up or by finding spellbooks or scrolls in the world. A spellbook may contain a specific spell, or a maximum spell tier. Spellbooks with a maximum spell tier contain one spell of your choice from the spellbooks that you can learn from with a tier up to the spellbook's maximum spell tier.

Novice Spellbook.brief: You have access to the Novice spellbook.
Novice Spellbook.verbose: You are able to learn spells from the Novice Spellbook.

The Wizard's Addendum.brief: You have access to the Wizard's Addendum.
The Wizard's Addendum.verbose: You are able to learn spells from the Wizard's Addendum.

Natural Intellect.verbose: You have a natural intelligence which grants you advantage on intelligence checks.

Tier One Spells.verbose: Your powers are growing. You may now learn tier one spells from any of your spellbooks.

Looming Presence.brief: Gain advantage when intimidating entities with lower INT.
Looming Presence.verbose: Gain advantage when attempting to intimidate anything of lower intelligence than yourself.

Enchanting.brief: You may store your spells in gems. Tier 0 in a 10 gold gem. Tier 1 in a 100, etc. Reusable.
Enchanting.verbose: You may store a cost 0 spell within a crystal valued at 10 gold. cost 1 in a gem valued at 100 gold, cost 2 in a crystal valued at 1,000 gold, etc. Activating a crystal takes an action. Gems may be reused.

Font of Magic.brief: Forgo healing from rest to regain 2x the action points.
Font of Magic.verbose: Focus on recovering your magical energy during a rest. Forgo healing to instead regain twice the action points.

Minor Homunculus.brief: For 10 gold and 1 evening, attempt to create a Minor Wizard's Homunculus
Minor Homunculus.verbose: At the cost of 10 gold and 1 evening of work, attempt to create a Minor Wizard's Homunculus from the Book of Known Beasts.

Tier Two Spells.verbose: You have graduated from novice to proficient! You may now learn tier two spells from any of your spellbooks.

Channel Untapped Magic.brief: Make a D15 INT check. Success, cast a tier 2 or lower spell for free. Fail, 1d10 damage.
Channel Untapped Magic.verbose: You may attempt to channel untapped magic in the world around you. Make a D15 intelligence check. On a 15 or above, cast a spell of tier 2 or lower for free. On failure, suffer a rebound which deals 1d10 damage which ignores armor.

Dueling Mages.brief: Reaction. Contested INF check when targeted by a spell. Success: avoid.
Dueling Mages.verbose: As a reaction, when you are attacked by a targeted spell, force the caster to make a contested Inner Fire check. On success, suffer no damage or ill effects.

Commit to Memory.brief: After sleeping, declare a tier 2 or greater spell to have -1 cost for 24 hours.
Commit to Memory.verbose: Spend some time in the evening studying the nuances of one of your spells of tier 2 or higher. Upon waking up the next day, that spell costs 1 action point fewer for the day.

Offhand Spell.brief: You may cast a tier 0 and 1 spells as an offhand action.
Offhand Spell.verbose: You may cast a tier zero and one spells as an offhand action.

Tier Three Spells.verbose: Magical energy flows through you. You may now learn tier three spells from any of your spellbooks.

Deadman's Contingency.brief: Plan for when you hit zero health. Can use 3 spells. Requires power source.
Deadman's Contingency.verbose: Put in place a contingency plan for when you hit zero health. The contingency can involve up to three of your spells (powered by your remaining spellpower and/or enchanted crystals), and is chained together by an ethereal entity which acts as your proxy, and which exists for sixty seconds.

Greater Homunculus.brief: For 50 gold and 1 evening, attempt to create a Greater Wizard's Homunculus.
Greater Homunculus.verbose: At the cost of 50 gold and 1 evening of effort, attempt to create a Greater Wizard's Homunculus from the Book of Known Beasts.

Magic Resistance.brief: Half damage from magic attacks, SP saves with advantage.
Magic Resistance.verbose: You take half damage from magic attacks, and make spell power saves with advantage.

Greater Channel Untapped Magic.brief: Make a D15 INT check. Success, cast a tier 3 spell for free. Fail, 2d10 damage.
Greater Channel Untapped Magic.verbose: You may now attempt to channel tier 3 magic. On failure, take 2d10 damage.

Tier Four Spells.verbose: You are a master of your spellcraft. You can now learn tier four spells from any of your spellbooks.

Spell Invention.brief: You can invent your own spells. Attempt once per sleep.
Spell Invention.verbose: You are advanced enough in magic that you may begin inventing your own spells. To invent a spell, you must have either encountered something like it, or have a jumping off point in your spellbook. It can take long periods of time to craft a spell, and its success and cost will be determined by multiple rolls and saving throws, depending on complexity.

Major Homunculus.brief: For 1000 gold and 1 week, attempt to create a Major Wizard's Homunculus.
Major Homunculus.verbose: At the cost of 1000 gold and 1 week of effort, attempt to create a Major Wizard's Homunculus from the Book of Known Beasts.

Major Offhand Spell.brief: You may cast a tier 2 spell as an offhand.
Major Offhand Spell.verbose: You may cast a tier two spell as an offhand action.

Major Channel Untapped Magic.brief: Make a D15 INT check. Success, cast a tier 4 spell for free. Fail, 4d10 damage.
Major Channel Untapped Magic.verbose: You may now attempt to channel tier 4 magic. On failure, you take 4d10 damage.

Tier Five Spells.verbose: You have achieved the highest form of magic, and are a mage to be reckoned with. You can now learn tier five spells from any of your spellbooks.

Magic Redirection.brief: When you succeed at Dueling Mages, you may redirect the spell
Magic Redirection.verbose: When you succeed at Dueling Mages, redirect the spell wherever you wish.

Efficient Spell Invention.brief: Halve either time or cost of new spell creation.
Efficient Spell Invention.verbose: Halve either the cost or time requirement of creating a new spell.

Legendary Channel Untapped Magic.brief: Make a D15 INT check. Success, cast a tier 5 spell for free. Fail, 8d10 damage.
Legendary Channel Untapped Magic.verbose: You may now attempt to channel a tier 5 spell. On failure, you take 8d10 damage.

Wizard.standings: Wizards are known to be friends to all races, and get along particularly well with Halflings and Rangers.

Archer.description: Some of the best marksmen in the world, archers are naturals with ranged weapons. They are often attached to their bow, and carry it with them everywhere. Archers come from all walks of life; some compete in tournaments, others are hunters and farmer's sons. Still others have served in the military. Archers should stay off of the front line, instead picking off foes from a distance.

Ranged Weapon Proficiency.brief: You can use bows and throwing weapons without disadvantage.
Ranged Weapon Proficiency.verbose: You are able to use bows, throwing weapons, and simple projectile weapons without disadvantage.

Fletcher.brief: You craft your own normal arrows.
Fletcher.verbose: You know how to craft your own arrows, and always seem to have some on hand.

Rope Arrows.brief: When a rope arrow hits, a rope springs from it to you. Size based contested STR check to stop from moving away.
Rope Arrows.verbose: You have mastered the art of crafting rope arrows using minor magic. As soon as a rope arrow hits its target, a rope instantly appears connecting the target to your hand. This can be used to climb, or to tether enemies. If an enemy is tethered, you may make a size based contested strength check to stop them from moving away from you.

Huntsman.brief: You have advantage when attacking beasts.
Huntsman.verbose: You have advantage when attacking beasts.

Dual Shot.brief: Fire 2 arrows in a single attack. For standard arrows, adds a dice of damage.
Dual Shot.verbose: Fire two arrows at the same target in a single attack. With standard arrows, this effectively adds a dice of damage.

Listen.brief: You have advantage on perception checks.
Listen.verbose: You have advantage on perception checks. Does not include initiative.

Mantle.verbose: You have advantage on dexterity checks when climbing.

Smoke Arrows.verbose: You can now craft smoke arrows. When a smoke arrow hits the ground, it creates a smokescreen with a 30 foot radius.

Net Arrows.brief: SP save or grappled. Each turn, STR SP save.
Net Arrows.verbose: You can now craft net arrows. When a net arrow hits its target, they must make an inner fire saving throw against your spell power. On failure, they are instantly wrapped in a net, and are considered restrained. Each turn, they may make a strength saving throw against your spell power to attempt to break out of the net.

Reflexes.brief: Reaction. 1/turn, reduce a projectile's damage by 1d20. If reduced to 0, catch.
Reflexes.verbose: Reaction, attempt to catch a projectile. Roll a d20, and reduce the projectile's damage by that amount. If reduced to zero, you catch the projectile.

Fire and Ice Arrows.brief: Additional dice of fire (repeat) or ice (push back in initiative) damage.
Fire and Ice Arrows.verbose: You have mastered the art of crafting fire and ice arrows, and can craft at most 2 per day. Fire arrows do an additional dice of fire damage and deal half as much burn damage to enemies that fail a saving throw against your spell power. Ice arrows deal an additional dice of ice damage, and cause an enemy to move backward 1d4 spaces in the initiative order of they fail a saving throw against your spell power.

Vampiric Arrows.brief: Extra dice of damage. Half of all damage returns as health.
Vampiric Arrows.verbose: You can now craft vampiric arrows. Vampiric arrows do an additional dice of damage to an entity. Half of all damage done by the vampiric returns to you as health.

Steady.verbose: Do not take disadvantage when being jostled about.

Explosive Arrows.verbose: After much experimentation, you have finally mastered the art of crafting explosive arrows. Explosive arrows do 4d10 damage to all enemies in a twenty foot radius.

Shadow and Light Arrows.brief: Additional dice of shadow (blind) or light (double vs undead) damage.
Shadow and Light Arrows.verbose: You have mastered the art of crafting shadow and light arrows. Shadow arrows do an additional dice of dark damage and cause enemies who fail an inner fire saving throw against your spell power to go blind until they make a spell power save. This save is repeated at the end of each of  their turns or once every ten minutes. Light arrows deal an additional dice of light damage, or twice as much to the undead.

Offhand Attack.brief: You may attack as an offhand.
Offhand Attack.verbose: You may use an offhand action to make an attack.

Shock Arrows.verbose: You can now craft shock arrows. When a shock arrow hits an enemy, it deals an additional dice of shock damage. If an affected entity is wearing metal armor or is made of or standing in water, they take a second additional dice of damage. The affected entity must make an inner fire saving throw against your spell power. On failure, they are knocked prone.

Greater Reflexes.brief: Reaction. If you catch an arrow, fire it back at the enemy.
Greater Reflexes.verbose: If you catch a weapon with reflexes, you may immediately make an attack with it.

Blink Arrows.brief: You can craft blink arrows, which teleport you to where they hit.
Blink Arrows.verbose: After learning more about magic, you have learned how to create blink arrows. Blink arrows instantly teleport you to the position that they hit.

Uncanny Perception.brief: You can see in pitch dark, have PER advantage, and role initiative with advantage.
Uncanny Perception.verbose: You have uncanny perception, which allows you to sense your way in total darkness, gives you advantage on all perception checks, and let you role initiative with advantage.

True Mastery.brief: Every ranged weapon is at least 1d12 to you.
True Mastery.verbose: Every ranged weapon functions as at least a d12 weapon in your hands.

Expert Fletcher.verbose: All arrows now cost 1 action point less.

Delayed Explosive Arrows.brief: Fire an explosive arrow which detonates when you say a command word.
Delayed Explosive Arrows.verbose: Fire an explosive arrow which detonates when you speak a command word.

Volley.brief: Attack all enemies you can see in one action.
Volley.verbose: Attack every enemy you can see in a single action.

Anti-Gravity Arrows.brief: SP save or gravity is reversed for them. Lasts 1 min, 1d4 turns, or till save.
Anti-Gravity Arrows.verbose: You can now craft Anti-Gravity arrows. When an Anti-Gravity arrow hits its target, they must make an inner fire saving throw against your spell power. On failure, gravity is reversed for them, and they fly towards the sky. Anti-gravity arrows last for one minute, 1d4 turns, or until the entity succeeds its spell power saving throw.

Firestorm Arrows.brief: After 1 turn, 15 ft. diameter. pillar of flame for 3 turns. 4d10 dmg.
Firestorm Arrows.verbose: You can now craft firestorm arrows. A firestorm arrow does nothing for one turn or one minute after it strikes something. Then, it explodes into a massive pillar of flame with a fifteen foot diameter. All entities caught in the pillar of flame take 8d10 damage instantly. The pillar of flame stays for 3 turns.

Archer.standings: Excellent archers, Marksmen come from all walks of life.

Marksman.description: Through luck, valor, or perhaps trickery, the Gunslinger has managed to acquire one of the rarest weapons in the world. As such, they have a close bond with their gun, which is usually their primary means of income. At the beginning of their adventure, a gunsling may choose to start with either a rifle or a pistol, a decision that determines engagement range and their upgrade path.

Proficient With Firearms.brief: You don't take disadvantage when using firearms.
Proficient With Firearms.verbose: You are able to use firearms without disadvantage.

This is my Weapon.brief: Don't forget to name your gun.
This is my Weapon.verbose: Your gun is the only friend you need. Make sure to give it a name.

Natural Intellect.verbose: You have a natural intelligence which grants you advantage on intelligence checks.

Called Shot.brief: Extra damage dice. SP save or drop weapon, fall 50 feet if flying, be blinded, or be knocked prone.
Called Shot.verbose: Aim for a specific part of an enemy. Add an extra damage dice. The enemy must make a spell power save or drop a weapon, be blinded, drop 50 feet if flying, or be knocked prone.

Strike From the Shadows.brief: Do an additional dice of damage on attacks made from hiding.
Strike From the Shadows.verbose: Do an additional dice of damage on an attacks made from hiding.

Disappear.brief: Offhand. Attempt to hide. Must be out of sight and out of mind.
Disappear.verbose: Use an offhand action to attempt to hide. You must be out of line of sight of enemies and not where they would reasonably expect you to be.

Listen.brief: You have advantage on perception checks.
Listen.verbose: You have advantage on perception checks. Does not include initiative.

Focus.brief: Gain advantage on a shot. Negates distance checks.
Focus.verbose: Focus before a shot to gain advantage on it. Removes distance penalties.

Harrying Shots.brief: When you successfully attack an enemy, they are considered harried.
Harrying Shots.verbose: When you successfully attack an enemy, they are considered harried.

Bull Rush.brief: Rush forward at 10 ft, may end in melee attack w/ extra dmg dice. SP save or fall prone.
Bull Rush.verbose: Spend 1 action point to rush forward 10 feet. This rush may end in a melee attack which does an additional dice of damage to your target. The target must win at a contested strength check or fall prone.

Tracer Round.brief: Additional dice of fire damage, next attack against enemy is with advantage.
Tracer Round.verbose: Fire a bright tracer round to gauge the exact distance to an enemy. Add a dice of fire damage to the attack and give the next attack made against the enemy advantage.

Reduced Critical.verbose: Decrease your critical hit target by 1.

Steady.verbose: Do not take disadvantage when being jostled about.

Forceful Shot.brief: Additional dice of damage. SP save or pushed back 15 feet.
Forceful Shot.verbose: Fire a shot which carries force behind it. Add an additional dice of damage and force the enemy to make an inner fire saving throw against your spell power. On failure, they are pushed back fifteen feet.

Vicious Critical.brief: On a crit, do an additional dice of damage.
Vicious Critical.verbose: On a critical hit, do an extra dice of damage.

Line Them Up.brief: If you slay an enemy, gain another attack and 10ft. of movement.
Line Them Up.verbose: If you slay an enemy, gain another attack action and 10 feet of movement.

Offhand Attack.brief: You may attack as an offhand.
Offhand Attack.verbose: You may use an offhand action to make an attack.

Warrior Spirit.brief: Gain 1 AP when you kill an enemy.
Warrior Spirit.verbose: If you slay an enemy, regain one action point.

Greater Bull Rush.brief: Bull rush now carries you 20 feet.
Greater Bull Rush.verbose: Bull rush now carries you 20 feet.

Greater Firearm Creation and Modificatio.brief: You have advantage when creating or modifying firearms and can use advanced designs.
Greater Firearm Creation and Modificatio.verbose: You have advantage on checks used to create and modify firearms, and have access to advanced firearm designs.

Assassinate.brief: 2 additional dice of damage on attacks made from hiding.
Assassinate.verbose: Do two dice of damage on attacks made from hiding. Replaces Strike from the Shadows.

Set Up.brief: Spend five minutes or 1 round of combat to ensure that your next shot is a crit.
Set Up.verbose: Take five minutes or 1 round of combat to guarantee that your next shot is a critical hit.

Called Critical.brief: On crit, apply a called shot effect to the enemy.
Called Critical.verbose: On critical hit, immediately apply one of the effects from called shot to the enemy. If the critical is on a called shot, apply a second effect.

Greater Armor Penetrating Rounds.brief: Your shots can pass through up to 3 enemies.
Greater Armor Penetrating Rounds.verbose: Your shots now pass up to three enemies.

Reduced Critical.verbose: Decrease your critical hit target by 1.

Greater Line Them Up.brief: On crit, gain another attack and 10ft. of movement.
Greater Line Them Up.verbose: When you score a critical hit on an enemy, gain another attack action and 10 feet of movement.
